meaningMnemonic:
Trace something back through its <kanji>lineage</kanji> to determine what <vocabulary>type</vocabulary> of thing it is. 

〜系 is a suffix you can attach casually to a word to classify it as a <vocabulary>genre</vocabulary> or group, like 理系 (science-oriented fields), おしゃれ系 (trendy or stylish people), or 日系 (Japanese descendants).
readingMnemonic: The reading is the same as what you learned with the kanji, probably because this word gets stuck onto other things to describe tribes and groups.
